refnamediv.refpurpose: Converts a pitch-class value into cycles-per-second (Hz) for equal divisions of any interval.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Converts a pitch-class value into cycles-per-second (Hz) for equal divisions of any interval. There is a restriction of no more than 100 equal divisions.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: icps cpsxpch ipch, iequal, irepeat, ibase

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ipch -- Input number of the form 8ve.pc, indicating an 'octave' and which note in the octave.
iequal -- if positive, the number of equal intervals into which the 'octave' is divided. Must be less than or equal to 100. If negative, is the number of a table of frequency multipliers.

irepeat -- Number indicating the interval which is the 'octave.' The integer 2 corresponds to octave divisions, 3 to a twelfth, 4 is two octaves, and so on. This need not be an integer, but must be positive.
ibase -- The frequency which corresponds to pitch 0.0

listitem.para:
The following are essentially the same
ia = cpspch(8.02) ib cps2pch 8.02, 12 ic cpsxpch 8.02, 12, 2, 1.02197503906
Negative values of ipch are allowed, but not negative irepeat, iequal or ibase.
